intro: Rhynchotechum tenue, commonly known as the slender thornplant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, upright stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and may have a slight pubescence, while the flowers are usually yellow or orange in color. Rhynchotechum tenue is adapted to survive in harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
